alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 10:05PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Rooks, Smith, northwestern Osborne, Phillips and southeastern Franklin Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 1004 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles south of Riverton to near Kensington to near Prairie View. Movement was south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. In addition, at 1000 PM CDT, estimated 50 to 55 MPH winds were reported by fire department personnel in Kensington Kansas. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Phillipsburg, Smith Center, Logan, Kensington, Agra, Lebanon, Kirwin, Prairie View, Gaylord, Portis, Glade, Athol, Speed, Harlan, Cedar and Bellaire. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for north central Kansas.
